Meeting Held at Delaware College on
February 13, 14 and 15. Prominent Speakers Address Group

MOTOR MISHAP MARS
CONFERENCE TRIP
Karl E. Miller, President
of the Y. M. C. A., was cut
over the right eye when two
buses carrying 51 delegates
from Maryland to the Interstate Student Conference at
the University of Delaware,
overturned at Charlestown,
about eight o'clock Friday
night.
One bus had broken down
outside of Belair, and the
other had started to tow it.
The difficulty of the arrangement resulted in the
accident.
Five representatives from
other Maryland institutions

February 13, 14 and 15. Prominent Speakers Address Group

MOTOR MISHAP MARS
CONFERENCE TRIP
Karl E. Miller, President
of the Y. M. C. A., was cut
over the right eye when two
buses carrying 51 delegates
from Maryland to the Interstate Student Conference at
the University of Delaware,
overturned at Charlestown,
about eight o'clock Friday
night.
One bus had broken down
outside of Belair, and the
other had started to tow it.
The difficulty of the arrangement resulted in the
accident.
Five representatives from
other Maryland institutions
were injured. Most of the
Hopkins delegation went to
the Conference in an automobile, and were far ahead
of the main body when the
buses overturned.
